text: Many thanks for your input!

Hello there!
I maintain an app that integrates with HubSpot.
The app suddenly stopped working. The authorization method returns successfully the code but after that, the get access token method returns 301 - undefined error.

eg:
`let response = await this.HubSpot.oauth.getAccessToken({code, state});`

We haven’t made any changed. Are there any changes, or a known issue?

Thanks Thomas.  Yes, I'm working directly with the 3rd party API.  I want it to be triggered when a HubSpot ticket changes status.   I know what to do with the 3rd party app but I'm struggling with how to set up the HubSpot API to "tell" the 3rd party API when a ticket status changes.  Is that with HubSpot Workflows or is there some other way?  Thanks !
resolved that. Mandatory scope changes broke it. Give us a warning before changes like these please :pray:

Oh I forgot tickets aren't available in HubSpot's app webhooks. There's a few ways I can think of doing this.
1. You could trigger a workflow webhook, but you would have to create it manually as a ticket workflow.
2. You could also have a workflow to change a contact property which you could listen to within your app webhook.

:wave::skin-tone-5: I’m Francis from HubSpot Product

 We are looking for a few volunteers (3-5 folks) to participate in a research call centered around API Versioning. These will be 30 minute informal sessions where we will discuss:
• Your experience with API versioning at HubSpot
• What you like/dislike about the process
• Recommendations on what you’d like to see
If you are interested in participating, drop a message in this thread, thanks!

Hello all! I have had an integration around the POST /filemanager/api/v3/files/upload endpoint for a few months now.  Yesterday, it started throwing 405 Method not Allowed errors.  Has anyone run in to the same issue?
I have same problem today, can’t upload file using POST /filemanager/api/v3/files/upload

Just realized this was not a support channel.  I created a post on the forum here: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/POST-filemanager-api-v3-files-upload-returning-405-Method-Not/m-p/416749#M41331>
Thanks again Thomas.  I'll try both approaches and let you know how I make out.  Much appreciated !
I am wondering if an custom API can be built to share info with HubSpot and Hawksoft (insurance agency account management system). what is the price range of how much something like this costs?

Hello Nikita, absolutely.  This can be done quite nicely a number of ways.  Costs usually are dependent on what the scope of the data being integrated is.  Depending on complexity you can use tools like Zapier, or <http://Tray.io|Tray.io> for basic integrations. If this is more complex than a custom integration could be built, especially if real time data transfer is needed.  My team has done integrations like this many times.  Would love to chat more about this if you would like to...
My issue was fixed by using `https` instead of `http`
thanks

Hi Tim! I am still in the quoting stages with the client so this could be a definite collab project. can you email me <mailto:niki@kulturekonnect.com|niki@kulturekonnect.com> Are we talking $200? $1000? $10,000? $100,000!?!?!?!     roughly? just want to be ready with a range while I candidly talk to the client about possibilities.
huzzah!

I bet we aren't the only ones who tend to copy/paste urls from docs. Maybe this url could be updated?

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/files/v3/upload_new_file>
NEVER!
it was a test!
but fine…
(also, thanks for letting us know)
updated :smile:
and thanks to you all, we found a couple other places using http.  if you all see anymore, please shout!
Hi Francis, would be happy to help.

Hi,
I'm trying to make a CLI (Python) app to publish pages to HubSpot from our CI server. That are generated pages from some XML wrapped into a template we use on our site.
I've read a lot of api docs but still didn't get the main thing -- is it possible to build that kind of CLI tool? I mean it *must* work w/o human intervention (because of CI). I see OAuth2 mentioned everywhere, but there is shouldn't be a human in my scheme... so I'm totally confused.
